p.s: The language of the Sonnet 65 has many conspiciousconspicuous tingsthings.
In verse one ShakespearShakespeare repeats the word three times, which emphatisesemphazises the list of words.
Also he repeats the word O in line fifefive, nine and thirteen to show the beginning of the chapter.
The sonnets fits between the other sonnets of ShakespearShakespeare, because it deals with love, beautines and the power of destroying.
The other sonnets deal with love too and with other ordinary topics.
Also it has the same style, like the other sonnets.
That means all have 14 verses three normal chapters and a final cuppletcouplet, a cross rhyme, a regular metre and many stylistic devices.
